pageContext.description:
A possible fragment of a blade from a sword, dagger, or rapier of Middle to Late Bronze Age date (1000 to 800 BC). The blade is made of copper alloy and now has a red-brown patina covering much of the surface, including areas of the breaks. The fragment is sub-triangular in plan and lozenge-shaped in section but both of the 'edges' are worn and irregular. The fragment appears to taper quite rapidly, suggesting that this could be from towards the tip-end of the weapon. The break across the wider-end is straight and appears to have been carefully cut rather than having been snapped or broken. The shorter-end above is irregular.



Length: 16.21mm, width and thickness at one end 18.40mm and 4.02mm respectively; at the other end 13mm and 3.02mm respectively.Weight 4.06g.
